Package it.polimi.se2019.card.cardscript.command

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CommandErrorHandler
    Interface that defines how the error should be handled.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AddPowerCommand  
    AskAndSelectCommand
    the class that select a player or a block if the response of question is "yes"
    AskIfCommand
    It ask a question and generates a boolean variable based on the answer
    Command
    the superclass for all the commands of cardscript
    CommandError
    When a command has got an internal error, it defines that errors launched by the command
    CommandPattern
    The pattern for all the possible commands, which contains the type of the parameters, the casted parameters
    EnableCommand
    It enables the effect of the weapon passed as the parameter of the command
    EndIfCommand  
    GetBlockCommand
    Receive a logic expression that has to be associated with just one block.
    GetBlockOfCommand
    Receive a player from the parameters of the command and returns the block of that player
    GetPlayerCommand
    * Receive a logic expression that has to be associated with just one player.
    HitCommand
    It receive a block or a player.
    HitRoomCommand
    Hits all the players into the room of the specific block
    IfCommand  
    MarkCommand
    It receives a block or a player.
    MoveCommand
    It receives a block or a player.
    PayCommand  
    ResetDamagedCommand
    The command that reset all the damaged players from a specific (context) player
    SelectBlockCommand
    filters the blocks using the logic expression and asks the player to select one of those blocks
    SelectPlayerCommand
    *filters the plaers using the logic expression and asks the player who is using the weapon to select one of those players
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Commands
    It assigns a specific name to each command
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CommandExecutionException
    Defines the exception of the command
